firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support the ShopStack e-commerce platform. It prioritizes authorization independence by storing user-specific data under user-owned paths. This eliminates the need for complex security rules involving `get()` calls, ensuring atomic operations and improved debuggability. Products are stored in a top-level collection to allow for easy querying and display in the product catalog. Orders and OrderItems are nested under the user, creating a clear ownership structure and preventing unauthorized access. This design supports secure list operations (QAPs) by enforcing ownership at the path level. The structure also simplifies security rules by ensuring that all documents within a collection share the same access requirements (Structural Segregation).
